title: Breaking News: React 19 Released
description: New version of the famous framework is available
content: React 19 introduces several new features, including actions and new hooks.

title: New in Ruby 3.4
description: What is new on this new version?
content: If you want to learn more about this new feature, check out the proposal and the documentation. Read the Ruby 3.4 changelog to discover all the fun available in Ruby 3.4.

title: Drizzle ORM Crash Course
description: Drizzle ORM is a simple, lightwiegt ORM for TypeScript
content: Drizzle ORM is a simple, lightweight ORM for TypeScript. It is designed to be simple to use and easy to understand. It is designed to be used with MySQL databases, but can be easily extended to work with other databases. You can reach out more details on Drizzle ORM.

title: Testing with JWT in .NET APIs
description: JSON Web Tokens (JWT) are a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims between two parties
content: In .NET APIs, JWT is integrated through middleware for authentication and authorization, allowing developers to enforce access rules based on claims and roles.

title: Design (UI/UX) course for Developers?
description: I'm looking for the best UI / UX design course for the developers
content: Wanna learn all about design, from color theory to typography, UX for mobile especially. Content can be based on Sketch or Figma. I have some experiences with those apps.

title: Design localization with Localazy Figma plugin
description: Learn how to do it with Localazy and Figma
content: With Figma & Localazy, you can quickly test the compatibility of your design when new languages are introduced, translate banners and other pieces of visual content. After that, download translated strings to use them in your project.

title: Design approaches of Mobile-first, Desktop-first, and Responsive Web Design
description: This blog post is about the approaches of building a design for multiple screen sizes.
content: Generally, Design experts define some key concepts that ensure interusability for any cross-platform UX, for a coherent experience. These concepts include Composition of functionality across those platforms, Consistency of interfaces across these devices, and Continuity of content and data for possible transitions between platforms.

title: InVision shut down
description: Got overrun by Figma
content: UX design company InVision has announced plans to discontinue its design collaboration services at the end of 2024. In a blog post on the company's site, CEO Michael Shenkman announced the impending shutdown, while simultaneously ensuring users that nothing will be changing about the service over the next few months.

title: Design Reviews for Existing Features
description: Recently I've taken on the project of helping organize my team's design review process
content: How does your team maintain knowledge about your existing features? How do you go about figuring them out in the absence of updated (or any) documentation? Are there any other questions you would ask in a design review for an existing features?

title: Marketing Your Mobile App, The Steps For Continued Success
description: Here are some tips for continued success in marketing your app to new users and maintaining your existing userbase.
content: If people are using your app constantly, it is a sign that have made a connection with the product. Give them the opportunity to express their opinions with a popup invitation to leave a review, but remember that user experience should not be sacrificed by this tactic.

title: Marketing to Developers in 2024
description: Developers have an outsized impact on buying decisions compared to most individual contributors
content: In this article, we'll talk a bit about what makes marketing to developers tricky, developer advocacy, and our favorite way to market to developers. (Hint: Educating developers is marketing to them).

title: Marketing Games as a Part of Brand Strategy
description: Why do a brand might need a marketing game?
content: Let us briefly explain how to use mobile games in a brand strategy and how to build a competitive advantage thanks to them.

title: Marketing a SaaS Product as a Solo Developer
description: My marketing plan is simple, find X customers to pay me Y amount every month to achieve my first Z MRR
content: Marketing has changed drastically over the years from a traditional marketing approach to digital marketing and even at that, we are still seeing different diversities in digital marketing.

title: Marketing Tips for Developers
description: Developers hate marketing
content: That's why there's so much content by dev marketers showing other dev marketers how to promote dev-centric stuff without annoying the technical audience in the process.

title: Marketing Your Mobile App, The Acquisition Stage
description: With a user acquisition strategy, the possibilities are endless
content: Aim to get as many downloads as possible in the first week after launch. The more rapidly your app gets downloads, the higher it will rank in the App Store search results.

title: Marketing Strategies
description: Here are five easy but effective marketing strategies to give your business a boost
content: In today's fast-moving world, having a good marketing plan is crucial for making your business stand out in a crowded market and attracting customers.

title: Marketing strategy - How to go beyond propensity models
description: To answer these types of questions one can build a model based on historical data.
content: These models work very well to kick-off a marketing data driven strategy but they quickly show their limitations. We will discuss these limitations briefly and propose a different approach.

title: Query Data with DynamoDB
description: How would you get insights from a DynamoDB table?
content: While relational databases have great tools like SQL, DynamoDB queries look slightly different.

title: Auto Resize multiline TextInput in React Native

title: Understanding var, let, and const in JavaScript: A Comprehensive Guide
description: JavaScript offers three ways to declare variables: var, let, and const
content: Understanding the differences between these keywords is essential for writing clean, maintainable, and bug-free code. This post explores the distinctions in scope, reassignment and redeclaration, and the best practices for using each declaration type.
